intro: Leptodermis fusca, commonly known as the black-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and small, daisy-like white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to dry, coastal climates. Leptodermis fusca is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
